items.title: Most American weddings are a lot more extravagant than the nuptials of Amazon’s Jeff Bezos
items.description: Americans spend an average of $33,000 on their big day, which amounts to between 25% and 50% of their annual household income.

items.title: My friend asked me to chip in $1,600 for her son’s prom-night limo. Has the world gone mad?
items.description: “He is handsome and popular and has maintained good grades. My friend wanted to do something special.”

items.title: ‘He doesn’t seem to care’: My secretive father, 81, added my name to a bank account. What about my mom?
items.description: “Neither my mom nor I know anything about their finances.”

items.title: I’ve been a stay-at-home mom for 10 years. Do I take a part-time job to spend more time with my kids or get a job for six figures?
